NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Gorumara



Declared a wildlife sanctuary in 1949 and a national park in 1994, Gorumara is famed for its Indian one-horned rhinoceroses. It was once part of the royal hunting grounds during British rule.









DAY 2: Full Day Excursion â€“ The Famous 7 Points of Dooars

NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Bindu & Jhalong



These riverside villages were once part of Indo-Bhutan trade routes. The Jaldhaka Hydel Project is one of the earliest India-Bhutan collaborations.









DAY 3: Lataguri to Jaldapara â€“ Evening Safari

[cite_start]Established in 1941, this park was once the hunting ground of the Cooch Behar royal family[cite: 84]. [cite_start]It now protects the rare Bengal Florican[cite: 85].

NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Cooch Behar



[cite_start]Cooch Behar was a princely state that merged with India in 1949[cite: 102, 103]. [cite_start]The palace stands as a testimony to Indo-European architectural fusion[cite: 103].

title: BHUTAN Package
text:
Detailed Itinerary



DAY 1: Arrival & Transfer to Jaldapara


ğŸ“ Hasimara â†’ Jaldapara | ğŸš— 1 hr | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Jaldapara






Todayâ€™s Experience

Arrival at Hasimara Railway Station.
Transfer to Jaldapara (short drive).
Check-in at the resort.
Evening Jungle Safari at Jaldapara National Park (Home of the Rhino).
Briefing about the Bhutan entry procedure for the next day.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Jaldapara



Established in 1941, this sanctuary was created to protect the Indian one-horned rhinoceros. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site candidate and offers a prelude to the rich biodiversity of the Bhutan foothills.









DAY 2: Jaldapara to Thimphu â€“ The Capital City


ğŸ“ Jaldapara â†’ Thimphu | ğŸš— 5-6 hrs | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Thimphu






Todayâ€™s Experience

Proceed to the border for Immigration Permits.
Scenic drive to Thimphu (Capital of Bhutan).
En route stops:

Phuentsholing Monastery.
Chukha Dam Viewpoint.
Waterfalls along the Thimphu highway.

Check-in and evening leisure in Thimphu town.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Thimphu



Thimphu is one of the few capitals in the world without traffic lights. It replaced Punakha as the capital in 1955 and is the seat of the Bhutanese Royal Family.









DAY 3: Thimphu Local Sightseeing


ğŸ“ Thimphu City Tour | ğŸš— Full Day | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Thimphu






Todayâ€™s Experience

Visit Buddha Dordenma (Buddha Point): A massive 51m bronze statue overlooking the valley.
Tashichho Dzong: The fortress of the glorious religion, housing the Kingâ€™s throne room.
National Memorial Chorten: Built in memory of the Third King.
Simply Bhutan Museum: Experience living Bhutanese culture.
Motithang Takin Preserve: See the national animal (Takin).









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Buddha Dordenma



Completed in 2015 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Fourth King, this statue houses 125,000 smaller Buddha statues inside it, fulfilling an ancient prophecy.









DAY 4: Excursion to Punakha & Dochu La Pass


ğŸ“ Thimphu â†’ Punakha â†’ Thimphu | ğŸš— Full Day | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Thimphu






Todayâ€™s Experience

Drive to Dochu La Pass (3,100m). View the 108 Memorial Chortens and Himalayan range.
Proceed to Punakha Valley.
Visit Punakha Dzong: The â€œPalace of Great Happinessâ€.
Walk across the Suspension Bridge (Longest in Bhutan).
Optional: River Rafting in Mo Chhu river.
Return to Thimphu by evening.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Punakha Dzong



Built in 1637, this is the second oldest and second largest dzong in Bhutan. It served as the capital and seat of government until the mid-1950s and hosts the royal wedding.









DAY 5: Thimphu to Paro Sightseeing


ğŸ“ Thimphu â†’ Paro | ğŸš— 1.5 hrs | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Paro






Todayâ€™s Experience

Scenic drive to Paro Valley.
Visit Paro Dzong (Rinpung Dzong): A masterpiece of Bhutanese architecture.
Explore the National Museum (Ta Dzong).
Stroll through the historic Paro Town market.
View of the majestic Mount Jomolhari.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Paro Dzong



Built in 1646 by Ngawang Namgyal, this fortress defended the valley against invasions from Tibet. Scenes from the movie Little Buddha were filmed here.









DAY 6: Excursion to Chelela Pass


ğŸ“ Paro â†’ Chelela â†’ Paro | ğŸš— Half Day | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Paro






Todayâ€™s Experience

Drive to Chelela Pass (3,988m), the highest motorable road in Bhutan.
Witness panoramic views of Mt. Jomolhari and Jichu Drake.
Spot thousands of prayer flags fluttering in the wind.
Visit a Traditional Dressing Center (Try the Kira and Gho).
Farewell dinner at the hotel.










NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Chelela Pass



Separating the Haa and Paro valleys, this pass is considered sacred. The massive collection of prayer flags are planted here to send blessings through the wind across the Himalayas.









DAY 7: Departure â€“ Paro to Hasimara


ğŸ“ Paro â†’ Hasimara | ğŸš— 5 hrs | Tour Ends




Check-out after breakfast.
Scenic drive back to the Indian border (Jaigaon/Phuentsholing).
Drop-off at Hasimara Railway Station.
Tour concludes with happy memories of the Dragon Kingdom.

title: NORTH BENGAL Package
text:
Detailed Itinerary



DAY 1: Arrival at NJP â€“ Transfer to Panbu Dara


ğŸ“ NJP â†’ Panbu Dara | ğŸš— 2.5 hrs | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Panbu/Charkhole






Todayâ€™s Experience

Meet & Greet at NJP Railway Station / Bagdogra Airport.
Scenic Drive to Panbu Dara, a hidden hilltop offering 360-degree views.
Check-in at your homestay.
Visit Charkhole, a quiet forest retreat nearby.
Sunset views over the winding Teesta River.



ğŸ”­ Highlights

Panoramic views of Kanchenjunga (weather permitting).
Walk through pine forests.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Panbu Dara



Historically, Panbu Dara served as a natural watchtower overlooking the Teesta valley. It helped villagers monitor trade caravans and safeguard against invasions from the plains.









DAY 2: Panbu to Kalimpong â€“ The Silk Route Hub


ğŸ“ Panbu â†’ Kalimpong | ğŸš— 2 hrs | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Kalimpong






Todayâ€™s Experience

Breakfast with mountain views.
Transfer to Kalimpong, the historic trading town.
Sightseeing Tour:

Deolo Hill: The highest point in town.
Durpin Monastery: Consecrated by the Dalai Lama.
Cactus Nurseries: Famous for exotic Himalayan flora.

Evening walk in the Kalimpong Market.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Kalimpong



Once a vibrant hub on the Silk Route between India and Tibet via the Jelep La Pass. The town was controlled by the Bhutanese and later the British, making it a center of politics and commerce.









DAY 3: Kalimpong to Sittong â€“ The Orange Village


ğŸ“ Kalimpong â†’ Sittong | ğŸš— 2 hrs | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Sittong






Todayâ€™s Experience

Drive to Sittong, famously known as the â€œOrange Villageâ€.
En route, stop at the historic Coronation Bridge.
Visit Ahaldara Viewpoint for breathtaking views of the Teesta loop.
Explore the local orange orchards (best in winter).
Visit the bamboo church and traditional Lepcha houses.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Lepcha Heritage



Sittong is a stronghold of the Lepcha tribe, the indigenous people of the Himalayas. Their deep connection to nature is reflected in their bamboo architecture and sustainable farming practices.









DAY 4: Sittong to Takdah â€“ Colonial Cantonment


ğŸ“ Sittong â†’ Takdah | ğŸš— 1.5 hrs | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Takdah






Todayâ€™s Experience

Transfer to Takdah, a misty hamlet frozen in time.
Visit the Orchid Center (one of the best in Asia).
Explore the Tinchuley Gumbadara Viewpoint.
Walk through the Rungli Rungliot Tea Garden.
Stay in a heritage British Bungalow (if available).









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ British Takdah



Takdah started as a British military cantonment during World War I (1915-1919). The officers built numbered bungalows here (e.g., Bungalow No.Â 12), many of which still stand today as heritage homestays.









DAY 5: Takdah to Darjeeling â€“ Queen of Hills


ğŸ“ Takdah â†’ Darjeeling | ğŸš— 1.5 hrs | ğŸ¨ Overnight: Darjeeling






Todayâ€™s Experience

Drive to Darjeeling via the scenic Lamahatta Eco Park.
Arrive in Darjeeling by afternoon.
Evening leisure walk on the Mall Road (Chowrasta).
Visit Glenaryâ€™s or Keventerâ€™s for colonial-era confectioneries.
Shop for Darjeeling Tea and woolens.









NoteğŸ“œ History Insight â€“ Summer Capital



Established by the British East India Company in the 1830s, Darjeeling became the â€œSummer Capital of Bengal.â€ It was developed as a sanatorium and later became the center of the worldâ€™s most famous tea industry.









DAY 6: Departure â€“ Darjeeling to NJP via Kurseong


ğŸ“ Darjeeling â†’ NJP | ğŸš— 3-4 hrs | Tour Ends




Check-out after breakfast.
Drive towards NJP via Kurseong.
Stop at Eagleâ€™s Crag Viewpoint: Used by the British to monitor the plains.
Kurseong Tea Gardens: Walk through the estates that have produced tea since the 1860s.
Drop-off at NJP Railway Station / Bagdogra.
